revised_title: Plastic Deformation and Internal Stresses in Silver Chloride
tldr: This article investigates the internal stresses and plastic deformation in silver chloride through a photoelastic study of glide packets. The researchers discovered that the stress distribution in each plastically deformed grain can be resolved into two parts: pure bending about two perpendicular axes in the glide plane and a continuously varying stress distribution. The study provides insights into the nature of internal stresses in materials and their deformation mechanisms.
